summary: The Truckee Meadows Public Lands Management Act addresses land management in Washoe County, Nevada. It includes provisions for land conveyances to local entities for various public purposes (parks, schools, etc.), transfers of land to tribal entities, the designation of wilderness areas, establishment of National Conservation Areas, voluntary donation of grazing permits, and withdrawal of certain federal lands from mineral and other uses. The bill aims to balance economic development, conservation, and tribal rights.
